content.text: The Eliza plugin now includes a Web3 security check feature powered by GoPlusSecurity, enhancing security for blockchain interactions.
Tests have been added for the Coinbase plugin to ensure wallet functionalities are properly covered. The tests are located in the `__tests__` directory and use Vitest as the test runner.
A new NFT plugin has been introduced, refactoring the code to align with the existing codebase structure. Some functions within the NFTService are yet to be implemented.
The NFT Collections Plugin has been updated with brand-specific configurations for NFTpro. This includes UI/UX customizations, market stats integration, and Reservoir API support.

A new Chainbase plugin has been added to Eliza, allowing AI agents to access and analyze blockchain data across multiple networks using natural language queries. The plugin integrates with Chainbase's data infrastructure to provide real-time insights.

A database connection error has been reported when using the Image Generation Plugin. The error occurs in the participant management system, even though the plugin does not directly use database functionality.

A feature request has been raised regarding action handling in plugins. Specifically, when multiple actions like `raydium-deposit` and `deposit` exist, the system incorrectly triggers `deposit` instead of `raydium-deposit`. A better solution is being explored.

The cryptocurrency market has seen fluctuations in the prices of major assets. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) experienced a slight decline from $94,611.67 to $94,392.52. Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) showed a minor increase, moving from $3,267.18 to $3,282.39. Solana (SOL) remained relatively stable, with prices shifting from $187.65 to $187.95. Meanwhile, ai16z saw a notable drop from $1.39 to $1.15.

categories.title: Major Developments in AI and DAO Ecosystem (Jan 3-10)

content.text: The AI and DAO ecosystem has seen significant updates this week. Key developments include HTX and Bybit listings, as well as integrations with Arbitrum, Polygon, Eigen, and ApeChain. Grants are available for those working on integrations. Additionally, ARC Agents has partnered with Eliza Labs. The project is experiencing rapid growth, with 10-15 pull requests merging daily, around 11k stars, and 3k forks on GitHub. A major UI overhaul is also in progress.

A solo developer project that started years ago has now grown into a major DAO movement. It had a 100% fair launch on @daosdotfun, with the developer livestreaming and educating from the beginning. Now, hundreds of teams and contributors are involved, making it one of the top projects on GitHub for the past two months. The movement is described as organic and community-driven, with no need for a specific name.

Contributors are actively supporting the DAO through tributes. One user followed Shaw’s lead by sending 50% of their AICC to @ai16zdao, benefiting all 88k holders. This practice is seen as a way to shift the culture from competition to collaboration. Additionally, discussions are ongoing about improving party list allocations and ensuring fair participation.

The AI and DAO space is experiencing rapid shifts, with some describing it as a 'hostile takeover' by key players like @elizawakesup, @aicceleratedao, and @partnersDAO. Additionally, the ai16z partners NFT is being linked to DAO allocations, and @SOLsesame is reportedly working on something significant.

categories.title: Latest Community Updates and Coordination Efforts

content.text: Discussions and updates are ongoing, with efforts to automate information gathering and sharing to improve coordination in 2025.
A new post hints at an interesting development, with a shared image adding to the intrigue.
A community member is recognized for their contributions once again.
A call to reconnect and discuss ongoing projects is made, indicating continued collaboration.
A cryptic message and link spark curiosity among community members.
A post with an image suggests an update or announcement, though details remain unclear.
The Together AI medium model referenced in ElizaOS is invalid and does not exist. Attempts to use it result in errors. The model name should be replaced with a valid one.
Eliza fails to join Discord voice channels upon request, throwing a 'ReferenceError: VoiceManager is not defined'. However, it successfully joins when restarted while already in a voice channel.
When ElizaOS is restarted, replies to TWITTER_TARGET_USER are sent twice. This may be due to responses not being saved to the database under certain conditions.

A login attempt error occurs when running a character on a Linux Ubuntu setup, despite working fine on macOS. The error message suggests incorrect credentials, but the issue persists even with correct parameters.

A fix has been implemented to complete DeepSeek API support in ElizaOS. The update ensures compatibility with OpenAI-style API formats and allows different model classes (SMALL, MEDIUM, LARGE) to function correctly.

categories.title: Updates to README Translations and Documentation Structure

content.text: The README translations have been reorganized into a dedicated `i18n/readme/` directory to improve project structure. This change updates file paths for translations, modifies GitHub workflow output paths, and ensures all translation links in the main README.md point to the new directory. The update does not affect code functionality and has a low risk impact.
The README_PTBR.md file has been revamped to provide clearer and updated instructions. Additionally, a redundancy in the main README.md regarding supported models has been removed.
A new README file in Romanian (README_RO) has been added to increase the project's visibility in Romania.

categories.title: Custom S3 Endpoint Support in plugin-node

content.text: A new feature has been introduced to the `plugin-node` package, allowing users to specify a custom S3 endpoint via the `AWS_S3_ENDPOINT` environment variable. This change ensures that the plugin is no longer restricted to AWS S3 and can work with any S3-compatible storage solutions, such as MinIO. If the variable is not set, the plugin defaults to AWS S3, maintaining backward compatibility.

The update was tested against a Web3-native object storage layer called Basin, which has S3 compatibility. The implementation allows users to configure the endpoint dynamically, making it easier to integrate with various S3-compatible services. The documentation has been updated to reflect this change, and an example `.env` file has been provided.

Additionally, the feature request that led to this change highlighted the need for more flexibility in the S3 plugin. The request suggested that without this feature, users would encounter authentication errors when trying to use non-AWS S3-compatible services. Future improvements could include additional S3 operations such as creating, listing, and querying buckets.

categories.title: Build Error in ElizaOS: Incompatible Parameter Types

content.text: A build error occurs when running `pnpm build` in the ElizaOS repository. The error message indicates an issue with incompatible parameter types for 'url' and 'request'. Specifically, TypeScript reports that 'Request' is not assignable to type 'string'.

To reproduce the issue, users can clone the repository, install dependencies using `pnpm install --no-frozen-lockfile`, and attempt to build with `pnpm build`. The expected behavior is a successful build, but instead, the process fails with a DTS build error.
The issue has been reported on MacOS 15.1 with Node v23.3.0 and PNPM 9.14.4.
No additional context is provided for the source 'https://t.co/KSEGR0nHFW'.
Builders focus on development rather than price charts. Tracking GitHub activity, such as stars for @ai16zdao, can indicate where builders are heading.
A GitHub pull request adds 'GITHUB' to the client enumeration to resolve an error when running the system. This change ensures compatibility with the live GitHub client version 0.1.7.

The provided chat transcripts contain minimal or no meaningful discussion. One transcript includes a single relevant message from a user asking how to add a bot or feed to their server, but no response was recorded. The other transcript consists entirely of messages from a single user without any actual content. As a result, no technical discussions, problem-solving, or significant interactions were present.
